monsters.name: Tissina Khyret

traits.name: Dark Devotion
traits.desc: Tissina has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Tissina makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage. Or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

spells: Tissina's spellcasting ability is Charisma. She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Titivilus

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Titivilus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Titivilus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: Titivilus's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Titivilus regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes cold or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Titivilus dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Ventriloquism
traits.desc: Whenever Titivilus speaks, he can choose a point within 60 feet; his voice emanates from that point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Titivilus makes one sword attack and uses his Frightful Word once.

actions.name: Silver Sword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage if used with two hands. If the target is a creature, its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to half the necrotic damage it takes.

actions.name: Frightful Word
actions.desc: Titivilus targets one creature he can see within 10 feet of him. The target must succeed on a 21 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the target must take the Dash action and move away from Titivilus by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn't take the Dash action. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: Titivilus magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

actions.name: Twisting Words
actions.desc: Titivilus targets one creature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target must make a 21 Charisma saving throw. On a failure the target is charmed for 1 minute. The charmed target can repeat the saving throw if Titivilus deals any damage to it. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to Titivilus's Twisting Words for 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: Assault (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Titivilus attacks with his silver sword or uses his Frightful Word.

legendary_actions.name: Corrupting Guidance
legendary_actions.desc: Titivilus uses Twisting Words. Alternatively, he targets one creature charmed by him that is within 60 feet of him; that charmed target must make a 21 Charisma saving throw. On a failure, Titivilus decides how the target acts during its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: Titivilus uses his Teleport action.

spells: Titivilus's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: alter self, animate dead, bestow curse, confusion, major image, modify memory, nondetection, sending, suggestion

spells.Daily (3e): greater invisibility (self only), mislead

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The tlincalli makes two attacks: one with its longsword or spiked chain, and one with its sting.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Spiked Chain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 11) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tlincalli can't use the spiked chain against another target.

actions.name: Sting
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If it fails the saving throw by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Tloques-Popolocas
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Vampire Weaknesses
traits.desc:
The vampire has the following flaws:
[object Object]

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc:
If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to Polymorph into a Tiny bat, or back into its true form.
While in bat form, the vampire can't speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its Statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The vampire makes two attacks.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target, escape 13.

actions.name: Children of the Night (1/Day)
actions.desc: The vampire magically calls {@dice 2d4} swarms of bats, provided that the sun isn't up. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.

actions.name: Tloques' Berserker Axe +2
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage.

spells: Tloques can cast {@spell hold person} ({@dc 14}) at will, requiring no components, but his target must be able to see him.

monsters.name: Tooth-N-Claw
monsters.languages: understands Infernal but can't speak it

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: Tooth-N-Claw has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: Tooth-N-Claw has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of its allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Freezing Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: Tooth-N-Claw exhales an icy blast in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Torbit
monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.languages: Thieves' cant plus any two languages, Bullywug

traits.name: Assassinate
traits.desc: During its first turn, Torbit has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit Torbit scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If Torbit is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Torbit instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.desc: Torbit deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Torbit that isn't incapacitated and Torbit doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The torbit can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Swamp Camouflage
traits.desc: The torbit has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The torbit's long jump is up to 20 feet and their high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Torbit makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Torlin Silvershield
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, Torlin has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Torlin makes two longsword attacks or two longbow attacks. It can use its Life Drain in place of one longsword attack.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a {@creature zombie} under Torlin's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. Torlin can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The tortle can hold its breath for 1 hour.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +2 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shell Defense
actions.desc: The tortle withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges, it gains a +4 bonus to AC and has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in its shell, the tortle is prone, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge.

monsters.name: Tortle Druid

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The tortle can hold its breath for 1 hour.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Shell Defense
actions.desc: The tortle withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges, it gains a +4 bonus to AC and has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in its shell, the tortle is prone, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge.

spells: The tortle is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, guidance, produce flame

spells.1st level (4 slots): animal friendship, cure wounds, speak with animals, thunderwave

monsters.name: Transmuter

traits.name: Transmuter's Stone
traits.desc:
The transmuter carries a magic stone it crafted that grants its bearer one of the following effects:
Darkvision out to a range of 60 feet
An extra 10 feet of speed while the bearer is unencumbered
Proficiency with Constitution saving throws
Resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (transmuter's choice whenever the transmuter chooses this benefit)
If the transmuter has the stone and casts a transmutation spell of 1st level or higher, it can change the effect of the stone.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

spells: The transmuter is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The transmuter has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): light, mending, prestidigitation, ray of frost

spells.1st level (4 slots): chromatic orb, expeditious retreat*, mage armor

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the trapper is attached to a ceiling, floor, or wall and remains motionless, it is almost indistinguishable from an ordinary section of ceiling, floor, or wall. A creature that can see it and succeeds on a 20 Intelligence (Investigation) or Intelligence (Nature) check can discern its presence.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The trapper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Smother
actions.desc: One Large or smaller creature within 5 feet of the trapper must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw or be grappled (escape 14). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 17 (4d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. While grappled in this way, the target is restrained, blinded, and at risk of suffocating. The trapper can smother only one creature at a time.

monsters.name: Trenzia
monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Illumination
traits.desc: Trenzia sheds either dim light in a 15-foot radius, or bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. It can switch between the options as an action.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Trenzia has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: If Trenzia is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in 1 hour unless holy water is sprinkled on its remains or a dispel magic or remove curse spell is cast on them.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Trenzia uses Lightning Ray twice.

actions.name: Fire Ray
actions.desc: {@atk rs} +5 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. 10 (3d6) lightning damage.

spells: Trenzia is a 5th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). She requires no somatic or material components to cast its spells. Trenzia has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): mage hand

monsters.name: Trobriand
monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_immunities: fire, poison, psychic,  from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Fire Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever Trobriand is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: Trobriand is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Trobriand has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: Trobriand's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Trobriand makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Sword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 23 (3d10 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: Trobriand exhales poisonous gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: Trobriand is an 18th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, mage hand, prestidigitation

spells.1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield

spells.2nd level (3 slots): blur, detect thoughts, misty step, shatter

spells.5th level (3 slots): animate objects, Bigby's hand, scrying

monsters.name: Ulitharid

traits.name: Creature Sense
traits.desc: The ulitharid is aware of the presence of creatures within 2 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The ulitharid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Psionic Hub
traits.desc: If an elder brain establishes a psychic link with the ulitharid, the elder brain can form a psychic link with any other creature the ulitharid can detect using its Creature Sense. Any such link ends if the creature falls outside the telepathy ranges of both the ulitharid and the elder brain. The ulitharid can maintain its psychic link with the elder brain regardless of the distance between them, so long as they are both on the same plane of existence. If the ulitharid is more than 5 miles away from the elder brain, it can end the psychic link at any time (no action required).

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 27 (4d10 + 5) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape 14) and must succeed on a 17 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Extract Brain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the ulitharid. 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the ulitharid kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

actions.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The ulitharid magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 17 Intelligence saving throw or take 31 (4d12 + 5) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The ulitharid's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

spells.Daily (1e): confusion, dominate monster, eyebite, feeblemind, mass suggestion, plane shift (self only), project image, scrying, telekinesis

monsters.name: Umbraxakar
monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Living Shadow
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the dragon has resistance to damage that isn't force, psychic, or radiant.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the dragon can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the dragon has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (2d10 + 7) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 16 (2d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.desc: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
actions.desc:
The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.
[object Object]

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc:
The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).
In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (2d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

traits.name: Assassinate
traits.desc: During its first turn, Urstul has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit Urstul scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If Urstul is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Urstul instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.desc: Urstul deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Urstul that isn't incapacitated and Urstul doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Urstul makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Vajra Safahr
monsters.languages: Common, Dwarvish, Elvish, Giant, Halfling, Undercommon

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: Vajra wields the {@item Blackstaff|wdh}, accounted for in her statistics. Roll {@dice 2d10} to determine how many charges the staff has remaining.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Vajra has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Staff Spells
traits.desc: While holding the blackstaff, Vajra can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using her spell save DC and spell attack bonus: cone of cold (5 charges), fireball (5th-level version, 5 charges), globe of invulnerability (6 charges), hold monster (5 charges), levitate (2 charges), lightning bolt (5th-level version, 5 charges), magic missile (1 charge), ray of enfeeblement (1 charge), or wall of force (5 charges).

actions.name: Blackstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 ({@dice 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning, magic damage, or 6 ({@dice 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning, magic damage when used with two hands. Vajra can expend 1 of the staff's charges to deal an extra 3 (1d6) force damage on a hit.

spells: Vajra is an 18th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation

spells.1st level (4 slots): detect magic, identify, mage armor, thunderwave

spells.5th level (3 slots): Bigby's hand, geas, telekinesis

monsters.name: Valetta

traits.name: Divine Eminence
traits.desc: As a bonus action, Valetta can expend a spell slot to cause her melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If Valetta expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

actions.name: Breathe Weapon
actions.desc: Valetta can use her action to exhale a 5-foot-wide, 30-foot line of lightning (but can't do this again until she finishes a short or long rest); each creature in the line must make a 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 2d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Mace
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

spells: Valetta is a 5th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom. Valetta has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary

monsters.name: Valin Sarnaster
monsters.languages: The languages it knew in life

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Valin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: While her heart remains in Alessia's body, Valin re-forms inside her sarcophagus, regaining all her hit points and becoming active again.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Valin can use her Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with her rotting fist.

actions.name: Rotting Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

actions.name: Dreadful Glare
actions.desc: Valin targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her. If the target can see Valin, it must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of Valin's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies and mummy lords for the next 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Valin makes one attack with her rotting fist or uses her Dreadful Glare.

legendary_actions.name: Blinding Dust
legendary_actions.desc: Blinding dust and sand swirls magically around Valin. Each creature within 5 feet of Valin must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of her next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Blasphemous Word (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Valin utters a blasphemous word. Each non-undead creature within 10 feet of Valin that can hear the magical utterance must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of Valin's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Channel Negative Energy (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Valin magically unleashes negative energy. Creatures within 60 feet of Valin, including ones behind barriers and around corners, can't regain hit points until the end of Valin's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Whirlwind of Sand (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Valin magically transforms into a whirlwind of sand, moves up to 60 feet, and reverts to her normal form. While in whirlwind form, Valin is immune to all damage, and it can't be grappled, petrified, knocked prone, restrained, or stunned. Equipment worn or carried by Valin remain in her possession.

spells: Valin Sarnaster is a 10th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Valin has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): command, guiding bolt, shield of faith

monsters.name: Valtagar Steelshadow
monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.languages: Common, Dwarvish, Infernal, Terran, Troglodyte, Undercommon

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Valtagar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Dwarven Resilience
traits.desc: The valtagar steelshadow has advantage on saving throws against poison, and has resistance against poison damage.

traits.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: For 1 minute, the valtagar steelshadow magically increases in size, along with anything they are wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the valtagar steelshadow is Large, doubles their damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the valtagar steelshadow lacks the room to become Large, they attain the maximum size possible in the space available.

traits.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: The valtagar steelshadow magically turns invisible until they attack, cast a spell, or use their Enlarge, or until their concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the valtagar steelshadow wears or carries is invisible with them.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

spells: Valtagar is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Valtagar can cast {@spell disguise self} and {@spell invisibility} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation, shocking grasp

spells.1st level (4 slots): detect magic, identify, mage armor*, magic missile

spells.2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, mirror image, misty step

spells.4th level (3 slots): fire shield, Otiluke's Resilient Sphere, stoneskin*

spells.5th level (3 slots): cone of cold, scrying, wall of force

monsters.name: Vampiric Mist
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Life Sense
traits.desc: The mist can sense the location of any creature within 60 feet of it, unless that creature's type is construct or undead.

traits.name: Forbiddance
traits.desc: The mist can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

traits.name: Misty Form
traits.desc: The mist can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can pass through it without squeezing. Each foot of movement in water costs it 2 extra feet, rather than 1 extra foot. The mist can't manipulate objects in any way that requires fingers or manual dexterity.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.desc: The mist takes 10 radiant damage whenever it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, the mist has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc: The mist touches one creature in its space. The target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw (undead and constructs automatically succeed), or it takes 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damage, the mist regains 10 hit points, and the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

monsters.name: Vargouille
monsters.languages: understands Abyssal, Infernal, and any languages it knew before becoming a vargouille but can't speak

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Kiss
actions.desc: The vargouille kisses one incapacitated humanoid within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 12 Charisma saving throw or become cursed. The cursed target loses 1 point of Charisma after each hour, as its head takes on fiendish aspects. The curse doesn't advance while the target is in sunlight or the area of a daylight spell; don't count that time. When the cursed target's Charisma becomes 2, it dies, and its head tears from its body and becomes a new vargouille. Casting remove curse, greater restoration, or a similar spell on the target before the transformation is complete can end the curse. Doing so undoes the changes made to the target by the curse.

actions.name: Stunning Shriek
actions.desc: The vargouille shrieks. Each humanoid and beast within 30 feet of the vargouille and able to hear it must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of the vargouille's next turn. While frightened in this way, a target is stunned. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the Stunning Shriek of all vargouilles for 1 hour.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: Varnyr has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put Varnyr to sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Varnyr makes two attacks.

actions.name: Cane
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: Varnyr adds 2 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, Varnyr must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

traits.name: Plant Camouflage
traits.desc: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The vegepygmy regains 3 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vegepygmy's next turn. The vegepygmy dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Sling
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Plant Camouflage
traits.desc: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The vegepygmy regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vegepygmy's next turn. The vegepygmy dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The vegepygmy makes two attacks with its claws or two melee attacks with its spear.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Spores (1/Day)
actions.desc: A 15-foot-radius cloud of toxic spores extends out from the vegepygmy. The spores spread around corners. Each creature in that area that isn't a plant must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. While poisoned in this way, a target takes 9 (2d8) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Vellynne Harpell
monsters.source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: Vellynne wears bracers of defense and carries a wand of magic missiles (see "Actions" below).

actions.name: Vampiric Touch (3rd-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 10 (3d6) necrotic damage, and Vellynne regains hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. If Vellynne casts this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

actions.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
actions.desc: {@atk rs} +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of Vellynne's next turn.

actions.name: Wand of Magic Missiles
actions.desc: While holding this wand, Vellynne can expend 1 or more of its 7 charges to cast the magic missile spell from it. She can expend 1 charge to cast the 1st-level version of the spell. She can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge she expends. The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If the wand's last charge is expended, roll a {@dice d20}; on a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

spells: Vellynne is an 8th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): chill touch (see "Actions" below), light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation

spells.1st level (4 slots): comprehend languages, detect magic, ray of sickness, Tasha's hideous laughter

spells.2nd level (3 slots): darkvision, hold person, ray of enfeeblement

spells.3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, Leomund's tiny hut, vampiric touch (see "Actions" below)

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The velociraptor has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the velociraptor's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The velociraptor makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The troll has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Poison Splash
traits.desc: When the troll takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet of the troll takes 9 (2d8) poison damage.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage, and the creature is poisoned until the start of the troll's next turn.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Venom Spray {@recharge}
actions.desc: The troll slices itself with a claw, releasing a spray of poison in a 15-foot cube. The troll takes 7 (2d6) slashing damage (this damage can't be reduced in any way). Each creature in the area must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: Venomfang can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Venomfang makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: Venomfang exhales poisonous gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Vertrand Shadowdusk
monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Vertrand has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

spells: Vertrand is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Vertrand can cast {@spell disguise self} and {@spell invisibility} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation, shocking grasp

spells.1st level (4 slots): detect magic, identify, mage armor*, magic missile

spells.2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, mirror image, misty step

spells.5th level (3 slots): cone of cold, scrying, wall of force

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If Viari is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails. He can't use this trait if he's incapacitated.

traits.name: Second-Story Work
traits.desc: Climbing does not cost Viari extra movement. Additionally, when he makes a running jump, the distance he covers increases by 5 feet.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.desc: Viari deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Viari that isn't incapacitated and Viari doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Viari makes two attacks with his shortsword and two attacks with his rapier.

actions.name: +1 Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d6 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge
reactions.desc: Viari halves the damage that he takes from an attack that hits him. He must be able to see the attacker.

monsters.name: Victoro Cassalanter

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: Victoro wears a {@item ring of protection} and {@item glamoured studded leather} disguised to look like fine clothing. He carries a {@item rod of rulership} shaped like a ruby-tipped cane.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: Victoro has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

traits.name: Rod of Rulership
traits.desc: Victoro can use an action to present the rod and command obedience from each creature of his choice that he can see within 120 feet of him. Each target must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed for 8 hours by Victoro. While charmed in this way, the creature regards Victoro as its trusted leader. If harmed by Victoro or his companions, or commanded to do something contrary to its nature, a target ceases to be charmed in this way. The rod can't be used again until the next dawn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Victoro makes two attacks with his rapier.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Cloak of Shadows (2/Day)
actions.desc: Victoro becomes invisible until the end of his next turn. He becomes visible early immediately after he attacks or casts a spell.

actions.name: Summon Devil (Recharges after 9 Days)
actions.desc: Victoro summons a {@creature barbed devil}. The devil appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of Victoro, acts as Victoro's ally, and can't summon other devils. It remains for 1 minute, until it or Victoro dies, or until Victoro dismisses it as an action.

spells: Victoro is a 15th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). Victoro has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): guidance, light, mending, spare the dying, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): charm person, command, detect magic, disguise self, protection from evil and good, sanctuary

spells.2nd level (3 slots): augury, lesser restoration, mirror image, pass without trace, spiritual weapon

spells.3rd level (3 slots): blink, clairvoyance, dispel magic, magic circle, protection from energy

spells.4th level (3 slots): banishment, dimension door, divination, freedom of movement, polymorph

spells.5th level (2 slots): dominate person, flame strike, modify memory, insect plague

monsters.name: Vincent Trench

traits.name: Limited Magic Immunity
traits.desc: Vincent can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Vincent makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage, and the target is cursed if it is a creature. The magical curse takes effect whenever the target takes a short or long rest, filling the target's thoughts with horrible images and dreams. The cursed target gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a remove curse spell or similar magic.

spells: Vincent's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). Vincent can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect thoughts, disguise self, mage hand, minor illusion

spells.Daily (3e): charm person, detect magic, invisibility, major image, suggestion

spells.Daily (1e): dominate person, fly, plane shift, true seeing

monsters.name: Walnut Dankgrass

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: Walnut has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
traits.desc: Walnut can attempt to hide even when she is only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

traits.name: Wild Shape (Recharges after a Short or Long rest)
traits.desc:
As a bonus action, Walnut can assume the shape of a dire wolf. She can stay in this form for 3 hours or until she reverts to her normal form as a bonus action. She automatically reverts if she falls unconscious, drops to 0 hit points, or dies.
While transformed, Walnut's game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the dire wolf, except she retains her alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores.
Her attacks in beast form are magical. While in beast form, Walnut can use a bonus action to expend one spell slot and regain {@dice 1d8} hit points per level of the spell slot expended.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Walnut makes two attacks with Foremother or her longbow.

actions.name: Foremother (+1 Scimitar)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

spells: Walnut is a 7th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following druid spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, thorn whip

spells.1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, entangle, thunderwave

spells.2nd level (3 slots): flame blade, moonbeam, pass without trace

spells.3rd level (3 slots): call lightning, dispel magic, plant growth

monsters.name: War Priest

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The priest makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Guided Strike (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
reactions.desc: The priest grants a +10 bonus to an attack roll made by itself or another creature within 30 feet of it. The priest can make this choice after the roll is made but before it hits or misses.

spells: The priest is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): light, mending, sacred flame, spare the dying

spells.1st level (4 slots): divine favor, guiding bolt, healing word, shield of faith

spells.2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, magic weapon, prayer of healing, silence, spiritual weapon

spells.3rd level (3 slots): beacon of hope, crusader's mantle, dispel magic, revivify, spirit guardians, water walk

spells.4th level (3 slots): banishment, freedom of movement, guardian of faith, stoneskin

spells.5th level (1 slots): flame strike, mass cure wounds, hold monster

monsters.name: Warlock of the Archfey

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage, the warlock turns invisible and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It remains invisible until the start of its next turn or until it attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

spells: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 15}), requiring no material components:

spells.At will: disguise self, mage armor (self only), silent image, speak with animals

monsters.name: Warlock of the Fiend
monsters.languages: any two languages (usually Abyssal or Infernal)

traits.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: When the warlock makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a {@dice d10} to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

actions.name: Mace
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage.

spells: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 15}), requiring no material components:

spells.At will: alter self, false life, levitate (self only), mage armor (self only), silent image

spells.Daily (1e): feeblemind, finger of death, plane shift

monsters: Warlock of the Great Old One

monsters.name: Warlock of the Great Old One

traits.name: Whispering Aura
traits.desc: At the start of each of the warlock's turns, each creature of its choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage, provided that the warlock isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

spells: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 15}), requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect magic, jump, levitate, mage armor (self only), speak with dead

traits.name: Indomitable (3/Day)
traits.desc: The warlord can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

traits.name: Survivor
traits.desc: The warlord regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half its hit point maximum.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warlord makes two weapon attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

legendary_actions.name: Weapon Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The warlord makes a weapon attack.

legendary_actions.name: Command Ally
legendary_actions.desc: The warlord targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. if the target can see and hear the warlord, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

legendary_actions.name: Frighten Foe (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The warlord targets one enemy it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear it, the target must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of warlord's next turn.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The wastrilith can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Corrupt Water
traits.desc:
At the start of each of the wastrilith's turns, exposed water within 30 feet of it is befouled. Underwater, this effect lightly obscures the area until a current clears it away. Water in containers remains corrupted until it evaporates.
A creature that consumes this foul water or swims in it must make a 18 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the foul water for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. At the end of this time, the poisoned creature must repeat the saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 18 (4d8) poison damage and is poisoned until it finishes a long rest.
If another demon drinks the foul water as an action, it gains 11 ({@dice 2d10}) temporary hit points.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The wastrilith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Undertow
traits.desc: As a bonus action when the wastrilith is underwater, it can cause all water within 60 feet of it to be difficult terrain for other creatures until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wastrilith uses Grasping Spout and makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 30 (4d12 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Grasping Spout
actions.desc: The wastrilith magically launches a spout of water at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a 17 Strength saving throw, and it has disadvantage if it's underwater. On a failed save, it takes 22 (4d8 + 4) acid damage and is pulled up to 60 feet toward the wastrilith. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

monsters.name: Water Elemental Myrmidon
monsters.languages: Aquan, one language of its creator's choice

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The myrmidon's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The myrmidon makes three trident attacks.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Freezing Strikes {@recharge}
actions.desc: The myrmidon uses Multiattack. Each attack that hits deals an extra 5 (1d10) cold damage. A target that is hit by one or more of these attacks has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of the myrmidon's next turn.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The abishai's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.desc: At the start of its turn, the abishai can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abishai makes two attacks: one with its longsword and one with its claw.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

reactions.name: Vicious Reprisal
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage, the abishai makes a bite attack against a random creature within 5 feet of it. If no creature is within reach, the abishai moves up to half its speed toward an enemy it can see, without provoking opportunity attacks.

monsters.name: White Guard Drake
monsters.languages: understands Draconic but can't speak it

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drake attacks twice, once with its bite and once with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: White Maw
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Amorphous Form
traits.desc: White Maw can occupy another creature's space and vice versa.

traits.name: Corrode Metal
traits.desc:
Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits White Maw corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. if its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits White Maw is destroyed after dealing damage.
White Maw can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While White Maw remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from white stone.

traits.name: Killer Response
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn in White Maw's space is targeted by a pseudopod attack if White Maw isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (4d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) acid damage. If the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: Willifort can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Ambusher
traits.desc: In the first round of a combat, Willifort has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.desc: If Willifort surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage from the attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Willifort makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Read Thoughts
actions.desc: Willifort magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, Willifort can continue reading its thoughts, as long as Willifort's concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, Willifort has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) and Charisma ({@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Persuasion}) checks against the target.

monsters.name: Winter Eladrin

traits.name: Fey Step {@recharge 4}
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the eladrin can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sorrowful Presence
traits.desc:
Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is charmed for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws. The charmed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Sorrowful Presence for the next 24 hours.
Whenever the eladrin deals damage to the charmed creature, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d8) slashing damage, or 5 (1d10) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Frigid Rebuke
reactions.desc: When the eladrin takes damage from a creature the eladrin can see within 60 feet of it, the eladrin can force that creature to succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or take 11 (2d10) cold damage.

spells: The eladrin's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Magic Club
traits.desc: In the wood woad's hand, its club is magical and deals 7 (3d4) extra damage (included in its attacks).

traits.name: Plant Camouflage
traits.desc: The wood woad has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The wood woad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it is in contact with the ground. If the wood woad takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wood woad's next turn. The wood woad dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Tree Stride
traits.desc: Once on each of its turns, the wood woad can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living tree within 5 feet of it and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of it that it can see, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wood woad makes two attacks with its club.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (4d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Wyllow
monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The wyllow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the wyllow to sleep.

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
traits.desc: The wyllow can attempt to {@action hide} even when they are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Change Shape (2/Day)
actions.desc:
Wyllow magically polymorphs into a beast or elemental with a challenge rating of 6 or less, and can remain in this form for up to 9 hours. Wyllow can choose whether its equipment falls to the ground, melds with its new form, or is worn by the new form. Wyllow reverts to its true form if it dies or falls unconscious. Wyllow can revert to its true form using a bonus action on its turn.
While in a new form, Wyllow retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, and Dexterity are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, and reactions (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. It can cast its spells with verbal or somatic components in its new form.
The new form's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

spells: Wyllow is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, mending, poison spray, produce flame

spells.1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, entangle, faerie fire, speak with animals

spells.2nd level (3 slots): animal messenger, beast sense, hold person

spells.3rd level (3 slots): conjure animals, meld into stone, water breathing

spells.4th level (3 slots): dominate beast, locate creature, stoneskin, wall of fire

spells.5th level (3 slots): commune with nature, mass cure wounds, tree stride

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: Xanathar wears a {@item ring of invisibility}, a {@item ring of mind shielding}, and a {@item ring of force resistance||ring of resistance (force)}.

traits.name: Antimagic Cone
traits.desc: Xanathar's central eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 150-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, Xanathar decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. The area works against Xanathar's own eye rays.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (4d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc:
Xanathar shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:
[object Object]

legendary_actions.name: Eye Ray
legendary_actions.desc: Xanathar uses one random eye ray.

monsters.name: Xardorok Sunblight
monsters.source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.desc: Xardorok has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, Xardorok has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Xardorok attacks twice with a weapon or casts eldritch blast twice.

actions.name: Spiked Gauntlet
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, or 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage while Xardorok is enlarged.

actions.name: Eldritch Blast (Cantrip)
actions.desc: {@atk rs} +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 9 (1d10 + 4) force damage.

actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: For 1 minute, Xardorok magically increases in size, along with anything he is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, Xardorok is Large, doubles his damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in his attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If Xardorok lacks the room to become Large, he attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

actions.name: Invisibility {@recharge 4}
actions.desc: Xardorok magically turns invisible until he attacks, he casts a spell, he uses his Enlarge, or his concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment Xardorok wears or carries is invisible with him.

reactions.name: Hellish Rebuke (2/Day)
reactions.desc: When Xardorok is damaged by a creature within 60 feet of him that he can see, the creature that damaged him is engulfed in hellish flames and must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: Xardorok's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While Xilonen remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

traits.name: Grasping Tendrils
traits.desc: Xilonen can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to Xilonen, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a 15 Strength check against it.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: Xilonen can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Xilonen makes four attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (4d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tendril
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 50 ft., one creature. The target is grappled (escape 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and Xilonen can't use the same tendril on another target.

actions.name: Reel
actions.desc: Xilonen pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

traits.name: Low Cunning
traits.desc: The xvart can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

traits.name: Overbearing Pack
traits.desc: The xvart has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to shove a creature if at least one of the xvart's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Raxivort's Tongue
traits.desc: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sling
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Raxivort's Tongue
traits.desc: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.
