actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Damaged Flesh Golem
monsters.damage_immunities: lightning, poison,  from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Berserk
traits.desc:
Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.
The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

traits.name: Aversion of Fire
traits.desc: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The item is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Irrepressible Dance
traits.desc: When any creature starts its turn within 10 feet of the item, the item can increase or decrease (your choice) the walking speed of that creature by 10 feet until the end of the turn, provided the item isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Force-Empowered Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. 1d10 + PB force damage.

monsters.name: Dao

traits.name: Earth Glide
traits.desc: The dao can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the dao doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

traits.name: Elemental Demise
traits.desc: If the dao dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the dao was wearing or carrying.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.desc: The dao has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Dao makes two fist attacks or two maul attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 20 (4d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 18 Strength check or be knocked prone.

spells: The dao's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, stone shape

spells.Daily (3e): passwall, move earth, tongues

spells.Daily (1e): conjure elemental (earth elemental only), gaseous form, invisibility, phantasmal killer, plane shift, wall of stone

traits.name: Bonded Mount
traits.desc: The knight is magically bound to a beast with an innate swimming speed trained to serve as its mount. While mounted on this beast, the knight gains the beast's senses and ability to breathe underwater. The bonded mount obeys the knight's commands. If its mount dies, the knight can train a new beast to serve as its bonded mount, a process requiring a month.

traits.name: Sneak Attack
traits.desc: The knight deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the knight that isn't incapacitated and the knight doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The knight makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Lance
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge
reactions.desc: When an attacker the knight can see hits it with an attack, the knight can halve the damage against it.

traits.name: Echolocation
traits.desc: The darkmantle can't use its blindsight while deafened.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation such as a stalactite or stalagmite.

actions.name: Crush
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the darkmantle attaches to the target. If the target is Medium or smaller and the darkmantle has advantage on the attack roll, it attaches by engulfing the target's head, and the target is also blinded and unable to breathe while the darkmantle is attached in this way.
While attached to the target, the darkmantle can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The darkmantle's speed also becomes 0, it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the target.
A creature can detach the darkmantle by making a successful 13 Strength check as an action. On its turn, the darkmantle can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

actions.name: Darkness Aura (1/Day)
actions.desc: A 15-foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the darkmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the darkmantle maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). Darkvision can't penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

traits.name: Two-Headed
traits.desc: The dog has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dog makes two bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 ({@dice 1d10}) on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

monsters.name: Death Knight

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The death knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Marshal Undead
traits.desc: Unless the death knight is incapacitated, it and undead creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The death knight makes three longsword attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage, or 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Hellfire Orb (1/Day)
actions.desc: The death knight hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a 18 Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 35 (10d6) fire damage and 35 (10d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The death knight adds 6 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the death knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spells: The death knight is a 19th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

spells.1st level (4 slots): command, compelled duel, searing smite

monsters.name: Death Slaad

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The slaad can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The slaad's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The slaad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The slaad makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or greatsword.

actions.name: Bite (Slaad Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claws (Slaad Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

spells: The slaad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The slaad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect magic, detect thoughts, invisibility (self only), mage hand, major image

monsters.name: Death Tyrant
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Negative Energy Cone
traits.desc:
The death tyrant's central eye emits an invisible, magical 150-foot cone of negative energy. At the start of each of its turns, the tyrant decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active.
Any creature in that area can't regain hit points. Any humanoid that dies there becomes a {@creature zombie} under the tyrant's command. The dead humanoid retains its place in the initiative order and animates at the start of its next turn, provided that its body hasn't been completely destroyed.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (4d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc:
The death tyrant shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:
[object Object]

legendary_actions.name: Eye Ray
legendary_actions.desc: The death tyrant uses one random eye ray.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The deep crow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the deep crow can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the deep crow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deep crow makes three attacks: one with its mandibles and two with its claws.

actions.name: Mandibles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the deep crow can't use its mandibles on another target.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Deep Dragon Wyrmling
monsters.speed: 30 ft., burrow 15 ft., fly 60 ft., swim 30 ft.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Nightmare Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a cloud of spores in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage, and it is frightened of the dragon for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Deep Gnome (Svirfneblin)

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.desc: The gnome has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

traits.name: Gnome Cunning
traits.desc: The gnome has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

actions.name: War Pick
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Poisoned Dart
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success

spells: The gnome's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 11}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Demilich
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, psychic,  from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, stunned

traits.name: Avoidance
traits.desc: If the demilich is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the demilich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.desc: The demilich is immune to effects that turn undead.

actions.name: Howl {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The demilich emits a bloodcurdling howl. Each creature within 30 feet of the demilich that can hear the howl must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or drop to 0 hit points. On a successful save, the creature is frightened until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc: The demilich targets up to three creatures that it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a 19 Constitution saving throw or take 21 (6d6) necrotic damage, and the demilich regains hit points equal to the total damage dealt to all targets.

legendary_actions.name: Flight
legendary_actions.desc: The demilich flies up to half its flying speed.

legendary_actions.name: Cloud of Dust
legendary_actions.desc: The demilich magically swirls its dusty remains. Each creature within 10 feet of the demilich, including around a corner, must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the demilich's next turn. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect until the end of the demilich's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Energy Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Each creature with in 30 feet of the demilich must make a 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's hit point maximum is magically reduced by 10 ({@dice 3d6}). If a creature's hit point maximum is reduced to 0 by this effect, the creature dies. A creature's hit point maximum can be restored with the  greater restoration spell or similar magic.

legendary_actions.name: Vile Curse (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The demilich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.

monsters.name: Demos Magen
monsters.source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Fiery End
traits.desc: If the magen dies, its body disintegrates in a harmless burst of fire and smoke, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The magen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The magen doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The magen makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Deva

traits.name: Angelic Weapons
traits.desc: The deva's weapon attacks are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deva makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Mace
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
actions.desc: The deva touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 ({@dice 4d8 + 2}) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc:
The deva magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the deva's choice).
In a new form, the deva retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

spells: The deva's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The deva can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
traits.desc: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

traits.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
traits.desc: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

traits.name: Grappler
traits.desc: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The mimic can make three attacks; two with its pseudopods and one with its bite

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Avoidance
traits.desc: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Displacement
traits.desc: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The displacer beast makes two attacks with its tentacles.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Djinni

traits.name: Elemental Demise
traits.desc: If the djinni dies, its body disintegrates into a warm breeze, leaving behind only equipment the djinni was wearing or carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The djinni makes three scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning or thunder damage (djinni's choice).

actions.name: Create Whirlwind
actions.desc:
A 5-foot-radius, 30-foot-tall cylinder of swirling air magically forms on a point the djinni can see within 120 feet of it. The whirlwind lasts as long as the djinni maintains concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). Any creature but the djinni that enters the whirlwind must succeed on a 18 Strength saving throw or be restrained by it. The djinni can move the whirlwind up to 60 feet as an action, and creatures restrained by the whirlwind move with it. The whirlwind ends if the djinni loses sight of it.
A creature can use its action to free a creature restrained by the whirlwind, including itself, by succeeding on a 18 Strength check. If the check succeeds, the creature is no longer restrained and moves to the nearest space outside the whirlwind.

spells: The djinni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, thunderwave

spells.Daily (3e): create food and water (can create wine instead of water), tongues, wind walk

spells.Daily (1e): conjure elemental (air elemental only), creation, gaseous form, invisibility, major image, plane shift

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The doppelganger can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Ambusher
traits.desc: In the first round of a combat, the doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.desc: If the doppelganger surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage from the attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The doppelganger makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Read Thoughts
actions.desc: The doppelganger magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the doppelganger can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the doppelganger's concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the doppelganger has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) and Charisma ({@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Persuasion}) checks against the target.

traits.name: Multiple Heads
traits.desc:
The dracohydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the dracohydra has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.
Whenever the dracohydra takes 30 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the dracohydra dies.
At the end of its turn, the dracohydra grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken radiant damage since its last turn. The dracohydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown this way.

traits.name: Reactive Heads
traits.desc: For each head the dracohydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.desc: While the dracohydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dracohydra makes as many Bite attacks as it has heads.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) damage of a type chosen by the dracohydra: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

actions.name: Prismatic Breath {@recharge 4}
actions.desc: The dracohydra's heads exhale a single breath of multicolored energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 33 (6d10) damage of a type chosen by the dracohydra: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, it bursts into flames and is reduced to ashes. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the draconian must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The draconian makes two Serrated Sword attacks and one Tail attack.

actions.name: Serrated Sword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Shape Theft
reactions.desc: After the draconian kills a Medium or smaller Humanoid, the draconian can magically transform itself to look and feel like that creature while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation lasts until the draconian dies or uses an action to end it.

traits.name: Controlled Fall
traits.desc: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its body turns to stone and releases a petrifying gas. Each creature within 5 feet of the draconian must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends; otherwise the creature is petrified for 1 minute. After 1 minute, the body of the draconian crumbles to dust.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The draconian makes two Shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, it turns into a puddle of acid and splashes acid on those around it. Each creature within 5 feet of the draconian must succeed on a 12 Dexterity saving throw or be covered in acid for 1 minute. A creature can use its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature. A creature covered in the acid takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

traits.name: Glide
traits.desc: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The draconian makes two Dagger attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature, the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until the end of the target's next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

monsters.name: Draconian Mage

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its scales and flesh immediately shrivel away and its bones explode. Each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a 10 Dexterity saving throw or take 9 (2d8) force damage.

traits.name: Glide
traits.desc: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The draconian makes two Trident or Necrotic Ray attacks.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Necrotic Ray
actions.desc: {@atk rs} +4 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

spells: The draconian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

monsters.name: Draconian Mastermind

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its magical essence lashes out as a ball of lightning at the closest creature within 30 feet of it before arcing out to up to two other creatures within 15 feet of the first. Each creature must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 9 (2d8) lightning damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The draconian makes three Rend or Energy Ray attacks.

actions.name: Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Energy Ray
actions.desc: {@atk rs} +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage.

actions.name: Noxious Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The draconian exhales a 15-foot cone of noxious gas. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 21 (6d6) poison damage and gains 1 level of exhaustion. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, doesn't gain exhaustion, and is immune to all draconians' Noxious Breath for 24 hours.

reactions.name: Magic Shield (3/Day)
reactions.desc: When the draconian is hit by an attack roll, it can create an invisible barrier of magical force around itself, granting it a +5 bonus to its AC against that attack and potentially causing the attack to miss.

spells: The draconian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

monsters.name: Draconic Shard
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Deflection
traits.desc: The shard's AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The shard can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it takes 5 (1d10) force damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the shard fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: When it drops to 0 hit points, the shard disappears and leaves a Tiny cracked gemstone in its space. The gemstone matches the kind of gem dragon it was in life and has AC 20, 15 hit points, and immunity to all damage except force. Unless the gemstone is destroyed, after {@dice 1d20} days, the gemstone dissipates and the shard re-forms, regaining all its hit points and appearing in the place the gemstone once occupied or in the nearest unoccupied space.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The shard doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The shard makes two Telekinetic Rend attacks.

actions.name: Telekinetic Rend
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +12 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 15 (2d8 + 6) force damage.

actions.name: Inhabit Object
actions.desc:
The shard disappears as it pours its psychic essence into a Medium or smaller nonsentient object it can see within 30 feet of it, magically possessing it. The object uses the shard's AC, and any damage dealt to the object applies to the shard's hit points. The shard inhabits the object until it uses an action to leave; until it is turned; until it is reduced to 0 hit points; or until an effect that ends possession, such as a dispel evil and good spell, is used on it. When it leaves the object, it reappears in the nearest unoccupied space.
While inhabited, the object becomes a magic item if it wasn't already, and a Tiny cracked gemstone matching the kind of gem dragon the shard was in life appears somewhere on the object. The shard can cause the object to fly using the shard's own flying speed, use its senses, speak verbally or telepathically, cast spells, and use its legendary actions.
If a creature wears or carries the inhabited object, the shard can grant the creature the following benefits:
Each of the creature's attacks deals an extra 1d8 force damage on a hit.
The creature gains resistance to psychic damage.

actions.name: Psychic Crush {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The shard unleashes a pulse of psychic power. Each creature of the shard's choice in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on it must make a 20 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 55 (10d10) psychic damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

legendary_actions.name: Rend
legendary_actions.desc: The shard makes one Telekinetic Rend attack.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The shard uses Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Commanding Thought (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The shard targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 20 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the end of its next turn. While charmed in this way, the target becomes the shard's puppet, acting and moving in accordance with its telepathic commands. While under the shard's control, the target can take only the Attack (shard chooses the target) or Dash action on its turn.

spells: The shard casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}):

A creature takes 2d6 damage of a type this dragon has resistance to (your choice) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

reactions.desc: When a creature the speaker can see within 60 feet of it makes a damage roll, the speaker can roll a {@dice d6} and subtract the number rolled from that damage roll.

If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 15). Until this grapple ends, the target takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

actions.desc: The ooze expels a spray of its gelatinous mass in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (4d10) acid damage and is pulled up to 30 feet straight toward the ooze. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

traits.name: Fear Aura

On a failed save, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this golem's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is pinned beneath the bony pinion and restrained. The golem has two pinions, each of which can restrain one target. If a creature is restrained by one of the pinions, the golem can't attack with it. Any creature restrained by a pinion can free itself at the start of its turn with a successful 17 Strength (Athletics) check.

actions.name: Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage.

actions.desc: The golem emits a 60-foot cone of petrifying gas from its mouth. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or take 35 (10d6) poison damage and be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The restrained target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the effect ends on the target. On a failed save, the target is petrified.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragonborn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The dragonborn can cause the sword to flare with bright light, and the target must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of the dragonborn's next turn. The sword can flare in this way only once per turn.

actions.name: Healing Touch (1/Day)
actions.desc: The dragonborn touches another creature within 5 feet of it. The target magically regains 40 hit points. In addition, all diseases and poisons affecting the target are removed.

actions.desc: The dragonborn exhales fiery radiance in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. When the dragonborn uses this action, it can choose up to three creatures in the cone. These creatures take no damage from the radiance and instead regain 22 ({@dice 4d10}) hit points each.

monsters.name: Dragonborn of Sardior

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragonborn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.desc: The dragonborn exhales a wave of intense heat in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Metal objects in that area glow red-hot until the end of the dragonborn's next turn. Any creature in physical contact with a heated object at the start of its turn must make a 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 9 (2d8) fire damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The drow adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the drow must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spells: The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Drow Gunslinger

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Gunslinger
traits.desc: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature or attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on the drow's ranged attack rolls with a pistol. In addition, the drow ignores half cover and three-quarters cover when making ranged attacks with a pistol.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Poisonous Pistol
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) poison damage.

spells: The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}) It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Drow Mage

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
actions.desc: The drow magically summons a {@creature quasit}, or attempts to summon a {@creature shadow demon} with a {@chance 50|50 percent|50% summoning chance} chance of success. The summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

spells: The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Drow Priestess of Lolth

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes two scourge attacks.

actions.name: Scourge
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 17 (5d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
actions.desc: The drow attempts to magically summon a {@creature yochlol} with a {@chance 30|30 percent|30% summoning chance} chance of success. If the attempt fails, the drow takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage. Otherwise, the summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

spells: The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Druid

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit (+4 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

spells: The druid is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, shillelagh

spells.1st level (4 slots): entangle, longstrider, speak with animals, thunderwave

monsters.name: Dryad

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
traits.desc: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

traits.name: Tree Stride
traits.desc: Once on her turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be large or bigger.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit (+6 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

actions.name: Fey Charm
actions.desc:
The dryad targets one humanoid or beast that she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the dryad, it must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed. The charmed creature regards the dryad as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the dryad's control, it takes the dryad's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can.
Each time the dryad or its allies do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the dryad dies, is on a different plane of existence from the target, or ends the effect as a bonus action. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the dryad's Fey Charm for the next 24 hours.
The dryad can have no more than one humanoid and up to three beasts charmed at a time.

spells: The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.Daily (3e): entangle, goodberry

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.desc: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

actions.name: War Pick
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, or 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage while enlarged.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage while enlarged.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.name: Cunning Action
traits.desc: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.desc: The spy has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

traits.name: Sneak Attack
traits.desc: Once per turn, the spy can deal an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spy that isn't incapacitated and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the spy has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spy makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: For 1 minute, the spy magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the spy is Large, doubles her damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the spy lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage while enlarged.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The spy magically turns invisible until it attacks, deals damage, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the spy wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.desc: The duodrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.desc: If the duodrone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The duodrone makes two fist attacks or two javelin attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Dust Mephit

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.desc: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of dust. Each creature within 5 feet of it must then succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. A blinded creature can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Blinding Breath {@recharge}
actions.desc: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of blinding dust. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 10 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The mephit can innately cast {@spell sleep}, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.desc: The eagle has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

traits.name: Earth Glide
traits.desc: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Efreeti

traits.name: Elemental Demise
traits.desc: If the efreeti dies, its body disintegrates in a flash of fire and puff of smoke, leaving behind only equipment the djinni was wearing or carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The efreeti makes two scimitar attacks or uses its Hurl Flame twice.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Hurl Flame
actions.desc: {@atk rs} +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 17 (5d6) fire damage.

spells: The efreeti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.Daily (3e): enlarge/reduce, tongues

spells.Daily (1e): conjure elemental (fire elemental only), gaseous form, invisibility, major image, plane shift, wall of fire

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The egg hunter can breathe air and water.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: If the egg hunter is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the egg hunter move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the egg hunter is animate. Dragons have disadvantage on this check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The egg hunter makes two Barbed Proboscis attacks, and it can use Torpor Spores if it's available.

actions.name: Barbed Proboscis
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the egg hunter regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

actions.name: Torpor Spores {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The egg hunter releases a billow of sparkling blue spores. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on the egg hunter must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the creature can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn but not both, and it can't take reactions. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this egg hunter's Torpor Spores for the next 24 hours.

reactions.name: Rapid Adaptation
reactions.desc: When the egg hunter takes damage, it gives itself resistance to that damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The egg hunter can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The egg hunter makes two Egg Tooth attacks.

actions.name: Egg Tooth
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 17 (4d6 + 3) piercing damage if the target is an object.

monsters.name: Elder Black Pudding
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, prone

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Corrosive Form
traits.desc: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

reactions.name: Split
reactions.desc: When a pudding that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new puddings if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new pudding has hit points equal to half the original pudding's, rounded down. New puddings are one size smaller than the original pudding.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The dragon deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The dragon doesn't require air or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes one Bite attack, two Claw attacks, and one Tentacle attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 19 (2d10 + 8) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (1d6 + 8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. 12 (1d8 + 8) psychic damage. If the target is Huge or smaller, it is grappled (escape 18). The dragon can have up to four targets grappled at a time.

actions.name: Tadpole Brine Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc:
The dragon exhales brine in a 120-foot line that is 15 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 55 (10d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a success or failure, if the creature isn't a Construct or an Undead, it becomes infested with illithid tadpoles.
While infested, the creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself after it succeeds on three of these saves. If the creature is targeted by magic that ends a curse or restores 40 hit points or more, the tadpoles infesting the creature are killed instantly, ending the effect on the creature.
If a Humanoid is reduced to 0 hit points while infested, the creature is stable but remains unconscious for {@dice 6d12} hours. When the period of unconsciousness ends, the creature transforms into a {@creature mind flayer} (see the Monster Manual) with all its hit points. Casting a wish spell on the unconscious creature rids it of the infestation and prevents it from turning into a mind flayer.

legendary_actions.name: Tentacle
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes one Tentacle attack.

legendary_actions.name: Shatter Concentration (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon targets a creature it is grappling. The target's concentration on a spell it has cast or an ability it is maintaining ends, and the target takes 19 (3d12) psychic damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The lizard can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The lizard makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 21 (3d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the lizard can't bite another target.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target not grappled by the lizard. 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Elemental Spirit
monsters.speed: 40 ft., burrow 40 ft., fly 40 ft., swim 40 ft.
monsters.languages: Primordial, understands the languages you speak

traits.name: Amorphous Form (Air, Fire, and Water Only)
traits.desc: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The elemental makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1d10 + 4 + summonSpellLevel bludgeoning damage (Air, Earth, and Water only) or fire damage (Fire only).

traits.name: Trampling Charge
traits.desc: If the elephant moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the elephant can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the elk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Ram
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Emerald Dragon Wyrmling

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and can leave a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Disorienting Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a wave of psychic dissonance in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 17 (5d6) psychic damage, and until the end of its next turn, when the creature makes an attack roll or an ability check, it must roll a {@dice d4} and reduce the total by the number rolled. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects.

spells: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

spells.At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible), minor illusion

monsters.name: Emerald Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (2d8 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 19) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales crushing force in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 71 (11d12) force damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc:
The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Beam (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm emits a beam of psychic energy in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Intelligence saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The greatwyrm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 26}, {@hit 18} to hit with spell attack):

spells.Daily (1e): dispel magic, forcecage, plane shift, reverse gravity, time stop

monsters.name: Empyrean

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the empyrean fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The empyrean has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The empyrean's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 31 (6d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the empyrean's next turn.

actions.name: Bolt
actions.desc: {@atk rs} +15 to hit, range 600 ft., one target. 24 ({@dice 7d6}) damage of one of the following types (empyrean's choice): acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, radiant, or thunder.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The empyrean makes one attack.

legendary_actions.name: Bolster
legendary_actions.desc: The empyrean bolsters all nonhostile creatures within 120 feet of it until the end of its next turn. Bolstered creatures can't be charmed or frightened, and they gain advantage on ability checks and saving throws until the end of the empyrean's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Trembling Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The empyrean strikes the ground with its maul, triggering an earth tremor. All other creatures on the ground within 60 feet of the empyrean must succeed on a 25 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

spells: The empyrean's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: greater restoration, pass without trace, water breathing, water walk

spells.Daily (1e): commune, dispel evil and good, earthquake, fire storm, plane shift (self only)

monsters.name: Engineer

traits.name: Gnome Cunning
traits.desc: The gnome has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against magic.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) piercing damage. Or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

spells: The gnome is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence. It has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, mending, prestidigitation

traits.name: Hellish Weapons
traits.desc: The erinyes's weapon attacks are magical and deal an extra 13 (3d8) poison damage on a hit (included in the attacks).

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The erinyes has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The erinyes makes three attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. The poison lasts until it is removed by the lesser restoration spell or similar magic.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The erinyes adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the erinyes must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The ettercap can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.desc: While in contact with a web, the ettercap knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The ettercap ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ettercap makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage. The target must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Web {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. The creature is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained creature can make a 11 Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The effect ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10, 5 hit points, is vulnerable to fire damage and immune to bludgeoning, poison and psychic damage.

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.desc: The ettin has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.desc: When one of the ettin's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ettin makes two attacks: one with its battleaxe and one with its morningstar.

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Evil Mage

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

spells: The mage is a 4th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as its spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}; {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The mage knows the following spells from the wizard's spell list:

spells.Cantrips (at will): light, mage hand, shocking grasp

spells.1st level (4 slots): charm person, magic missile

monsters.name: Expert
monsters.languages: Common, plus one of your choice

traits.name: Helpful
traits.desc: The expert can take the Help action as a bonus action, and the creature who receives the help gains a {@dice 1d6} bonus to the {@dice d20} roll. If that roll is an attack roll, the creature can forgo adding the bonus to it, and then if the attack hits, the creature can add the bonus to the attack's damage roll against one target.

traits.name: Tools
traits.desc: The expert has {@item thieves' tools|phb} and a musical instrument.

actions.name: Extra Attack
actions.desc: The expert can attack twice, instead of once, whenever it takes the {@action Attack} action on its turn.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The eyedrake doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Antimagic Breath {@recharge}
actions.desc: The eyedrake emits a magic wave in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 39 (6d12) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Every spell of 3rd level or lower ends on creatures and objects of the eyedrake's choice in that area.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc:
The eyedrake shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), each ray targeting one creature it can see within 60 feet of it:
[object Object]

monsters.name: Faerie Dragon (Blue)

traits.name: The Colors of Age
traits.desc:
A faerie dragon's scales change hue as it ages, moving through all the colors of the rainbow. All faerie dragons have innate spellcasting ability, gaining new spells as they mature.
Red—5 years or less
Orange—6–10 years
Yellow—11–20 years
Green—21–30 years
Blue—31–40 years
Indigo—41–50 years
Violet—51 years or more
A green or older faerie dragon's CR increases to 2.

traits.name: Superior Invisibility
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the dragon can magically turn invisible until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the dragon wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.name: Limited Telepathy
traits.desc: Using telepathy, the dragon can magically communicate with any other faerie dragon within 60 feet of it.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The faerie dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage.

actions.name: Euphoria Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc:
The dragon exhales a puff of euphoria gas at one creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw, or for 1 minute, the target can't take reactions and must roll a {@dice d6} at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior during the turn:
1–4. The target takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a random direction.
5–6. The target doesn't move, and the only thing it can do on its turn is make a 11 Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast a number of spells, requiring no material components:

spells.Daily (1e): color spray, dancing lights, mage hand, major image, minor illusion, mirror image, suggestion
