actions.desc: The quadrone makes two fist attacks or four shortbow attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Wounded Fury
traits.desc: While it has 10 hit points or fewer, the quaggoth has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The quaggoth makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spore servant makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Quaggoth Thonot

traits.name: Wounded Fury
traits.desc: While it has 10 hit points or fewer, the quaggoth has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The quaggoth makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

spells: The quaggoth's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}). The quaggoth can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

spells.At will: feather fall, mage hand (the hand is invisible)

spells.Daily (1e): cure wounds, enlarge/reduce, heat metal, mirror image

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The quasit can use its action to polymorph into a beast form that resembles a bat (speed 10 feet fly 40 ft.), a centipede (40 ft., climb 40 ft.), or a toad (40 ft., swim 40 ft.), or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed changes noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The quasit has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Claw (Bite in Beast Form)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Scare (1/Day)
actions.desc: One creature of the quasit's choice within 20 feet of it must succeed on a 10 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the quasit is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.desc: The quasit magically turns invisible until it attacks or uses Scare, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the quasit wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The quipper has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.desc: The quipper can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

monsters.name: Rakshasa

traits.name: Limited Magic Immunity
traits.desc: The rakshasa can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The rakshasa makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage, and the target is cursed if it is a creature. The magical curse takes effect whenever the target takes a short or long rest, filling the target's thoughts with horrible images and dreams. The cursed target gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a remove curse spell or similar magic.

spells: The rakshasa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect thoughts, disguise self, mage hand, minor illusion

spells.Daily (3e): charm person, detect magic, invisibility, major image, suggestion

spells.Daily (1e): dominate person, fly, plane shift, true seeing

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The rat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.desc: The raven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Red Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Chromatic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled this way at a time.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales a blast of energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 78 (12d12) fire damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary_actions.name: Arcane Spear (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm creates four spears of magical force. Each spear hits a creature of the greatwyrm's choice it can see within 120 feet of it, dealing 12 (1d8 + 8) force damage to its target, then disappears.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The slaad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The slaad makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be infected with a disease—a minuscule slaad egg.
A humanoid host can carry only one slaad egg to term at a time. Over three months, the egg moves to the chest cavity, gestates, and forms a {@creature slaad tadpole}. In the 24-hour period before giving birth, the host starts to feel unwell, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. At birth, the tadpole chews its way through vital organs and out of the host's chest in 1 round, killing the host in the process.
If the disease is cured before the tadpole's emergence, the unborn slaad is disintegrated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ruffian makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Antimagic Cone
traits.desc: The beholder's central eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 150-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the beholder decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. The area works against the beholder's own eye rays.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (4d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc:
The beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:
[object Object]

legendary_actions.name: Eye Ray
legendary_actions.desc: The beholder uses one random eye ray.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The dragon turtle can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon turtle makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 26 (3d12 + 7) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d8 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Steam Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The dragon turtle exhales scalding steam in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 52 (15d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this damage.

monsters.name: Reduced-Threat Glabrezu

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The glabrezu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The glabrezu makes four attacks: two with its pincers and two with its fists. Alternatively, it makes two attacks with its pincers and casts one spell.

actions.name: Pincer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 13). The glabrezu has two pincers, each of which can grapple only one target.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

spells: The glabrezu's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}). The glabrezu can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Reduced-Threat Helmed Horror
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The helmed horror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spell Immunity
traits.desc: The helmed horror is immune to three spells chosen by its creator. Typical immunities include fireball, heat metal, and lightning bolt.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The helmed horror makes two longsword attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

monsters.name: Reduced-Threat Wight
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wight makes two longsword attacks or two longbow attacks. It can use its Life Drain in place of one longsword attack.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a {@creature zombie} under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +2 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The shark has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the shark's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.desc: The shark can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Reflection
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The reflection can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the reflection can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +6.

traits.name: Sunlight Weakness
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the reflection has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

actions.name: Strength Drain
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.
If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new reflection rises from the corpse {@dice 1d4} hours later.

monsters.name: Reghed Chieftain
monsters.source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Brave
traits.desc: The chieftain has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Brute
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the chieftain hits with it (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The chieftain makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Shield Bash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The chieftain adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the chieftain must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monsters.name: Reghed Great Warrior
monsters.source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Brave
traits.desc: The great warrior has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Brute
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the great warrior hits with it (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The great warrior makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Shield Bash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The great warrior adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the great warrior must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monsters.name: Reghed Shaman
monsters.source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit (+4 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

spells: The druid is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, shillelagh

spells.1st level (4 slots): entangle, longstrider, speak with animals, thunderwave

monsters.name: Reghed Warrior
monsters.source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The warrior has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the warrior's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monsters.name: Reindeer
monsters.source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the reindeer moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Ram
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.desc: A creature that touches the remorhaz or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 40 (6d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the remorhaz can't bite another target.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc:
The remorhaz makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the remorhaz, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the remorhaz's turns.
If the remorhaz takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the remorhaz must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet oft he remorhaz. If the remorhaz dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monsters.name: Revenant
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The revenant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the revenant takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the revenant's next turn. The revenant's body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: When the revenant's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another humanoid corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.desc: The revenant is immune to effects that turn undead.

traits.name: Vengeful Tracker
traits.desc: The revenant knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and the revenant are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by the revenant dies, the revenant knows.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The revenant makes two fist attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature against which the revenant has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the revenant can grapple the target (escape 14) provided the target is Large or smaller.

actions.name: Vengeful Glare
actions.desc: The revenant targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is paralyzed until the revenant deals damage to it, or until the end of the revenant's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is frightened of the revenant for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see the revenant, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success.

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the rhinoceros moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.desc: The roc has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The roc makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 27 (4d8 + 9) piercing damage.

actions.name: Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 23 (4d6 + 9) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the roc can't use its talons on another target.

monsters.name: Rock Gnome Recluse

traits.name: Gnome Cunning
traits.desc: The gnome has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

actions.name: Magic Missile (Expends a 1st-Level Spell Slot)
actions.desc: The gnome creates three magical darts. Each dart hits a creature the gnome chooses within 120 feet of it and deals 3 (1d4 + 1) force damage.

actions.name: Ray of Frost
actions.desc: {@atk rs} +4 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. 4 (1d8) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the gnome's next turn.

spells: The gnome is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost (see "Actions" below)

spells.1st level (3 slots): detect magic, mage armor, magic missile (see "Actions" below), shield

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

traits.name: Grasping Tendrils
traits.desc: The roper can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a 15 Strength check against it.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The roper makes four attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (4d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tendril
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 50 ft., one creature. The target is grappled (escape 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the roper can't use the same tendril on another target.

actions.name: Reel
actions.desc: The roper pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the rothé moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Rowboat Mimic
monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
traits.desc: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

traits.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
traits.desc: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

traits.name: Grappler
traits.desc: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

monsters.name: Rug of Smothering
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.desc: The rug is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the rug must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: Damage Transfer
traits.desc: While it is grappling a creature, the rug takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature grappled by the rug takes the other half.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the rug remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal rug.

actions.name: Smother
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. The creature is grappled (escape 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, blinded, and at risk of suffocating, and the rug can't smother another target. In addition, at the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Runed Behir
monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape 16) if the behir isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is restrained until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Lightning Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is 20 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc:
The behir makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.
If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

legendary_actions.name: Lesser Magic
legendary_actions.desc: The behir casts color spray or sleep, requiring no components.

legendary_actions.name: Greater Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The behir casts invisibility or misty step, requiring no components.

traits.name: Iron Scent
traits.desc: The rust monster can pinpoint, by scent, the location of ferrous metal within 30 feet of it.

traits.name: Rust Metal
traits.desc: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the rust monster corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Non magical ammunition made of metal that hits the rust monster is destroyed after dealing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Antennae
actions.desc:
The rust monster corrodes a nonmagical ferrous metal object it can see within 5 feet of it. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a 11 Dexterity saving throw to avoid the rust monster's touch.
If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, its takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held metal weapon, it rusts as described in the Rust Metal trait.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The tiger has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Sage

actions.name: Shocking Grasp (Cantrip)
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +6 to hit (with advantage if the target is wearing armor made of metal), reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d8) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

reactions.name: Shield (1st-Level Spell; 3/Day)
reactions.desc: When the sage is hit by an attack or targeted by a magic missile spell, it calls forth an invisible barrier of magical force that protects it. Until the start of its next turn, the sage has a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and it takes no damage from magic missile.

spells: The sage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks):

spells.Daily (3e): comprehend languages, detect magic, identify, [object Object]

spells.Daily (1e): dispel magic, levitate, locate object, see invisibility, sending, tongues, unseen servant

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sahuagin makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or spear.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sahuagin makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws or trident.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d4 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The blademaster has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The blademaster can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The blademaster can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The blademaster makes three attacks with its wavecutter blade, or one attack with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Wavecutter Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Sahuagin High Priestess

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The high priestess has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The high priestess can breathe air and water, but she needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The high priestess can magically command any shark within 120 feet of her, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The high priestess makes two attacks with her toothsome staff, or one attack with her bite and one with her claws.

actions.name: Toothsome Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

spells: The high priestess is a 7th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, resistance, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): bless, detect magic, guiding bolt

spells.3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, fear, mass healing word, tongues

monsters.name: Sahuagin Priestess

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sahuagin makes two melee attacks: one with her bite and one with her claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

spells: The sahuagin is a 6th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): guidance, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): bless, detect magic, guiding bolt

monsters.name: Sahuagin Warlock of Uk'otoa

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The warlock has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The warlock can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The warlock can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warlock makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its Sword of Fathoms.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sword of Fathoms
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or begin choking. The choking creature is incapacitated until the end of its next turn, when the effect ends on it.

actions.name: Eldritch Blast (Cantrip)
actions.desc: {@atk rs} +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 5 (1d10) force damage.

spells: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.Daily (1e): armor of Agathys, arms of Hadar, counterspell, crown of madness, invisibility, hunger of Hadar

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.desc: A creature that touches the salamander or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Heated Weapons
traits.desc: Any metal melee weapon the salamander wields deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The salamander makes two attacks: one with its spear and one with its tail.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, and the target is grappled (escape 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the salamander can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the salamander can't make tail attacks against other targets.

monsters.name: Sapphire Dragon Wyrmling
monsters.speed: 30 ft., burrow 15 ft., climb 30 ft., fly 60 ft.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The dragon can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and can leave a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) thunder damage.

actions.name: Debilitating Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a pulse of high-pitched, nearly inaudible sound in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (4d10) thunder damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated.

spells: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

monsters.name: Sapphire Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (2d8 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 19) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales crushing force in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 71 (11d12) force damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc:
The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Beam (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm emits a beam of psychic energy in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Intelligence saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The greatwyrm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 26}, {@hit 18} to hit with spell attack):

spells.Daily (1e): dispel magic, forcecage, plane shift, reverse gravity, time stop

monsters.name: Sapphire Sentinel
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, psychic,  from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Slow {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Sapphire
actions.desc: The sapphire has 3 charges. As an action, the golem can expend 1 charge to cast dispel magic (as a 9th-level spell) from the sapphire using Constitution as its spellcasting ability. The sapphire ceases to glow if all its charges are expended, but it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn and glows again once it has 1 or more charges.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Ram
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Scaladar
monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the scaladar is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage, and its sting deals an extra 11 (2d10) lightning damage until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Scaladar Link
traits.desc: The scaladar knows the location of other scaladar within 100 feet of it, and it can sense when any of them take damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The scaladar makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its sting.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 15). The scaladar has two claws, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Sting
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) lightning damage.

monsters.name: Scarecrow
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, unconscious
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the scarecrow remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary, inanimate scarecrow.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The scarecrow makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (2d4 + 1) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of the scarecrow's next turn.

actions.name: Terrifying Glare
actions.desc: The scarecrow targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the scarecrow, the target must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw or be magically frightened until the end of the scarecrow's next turn. The frightened target is paralyzed.

actions.name: Sting
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage, and the target must make a 9 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
traits.desc: The scout has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The scout makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The troll has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Sea Fury
monsters.damage_immunities: cold, fire, poison,  from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The sea fury can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the sea fury fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The sea fury has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sea fury makes two attacks with its claws.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Death Glare
actions.desc: The sea fury targets one frightened creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or drop to 0 hit points.

legendary_actions.name: As Water
legendary_actions.desc: The sea fury transforms into a wave of foaming seawater, along with whatever it is wearing or carrying, and moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks. While in this form, it can't be grappled or restrained. It reverts to its true form at the end of this movement.

legendary_actions.name: Fearsome Apparition (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The sea fury conjures an apparition of one of its dead sisters, which appears in an unoccupied space the sea fury can see within 30 feet of it. Enemies of the sea fury that can see the apparition must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of it until it vanishes at the end of the sea fury's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Conjure Snakes (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The sea fury disgorges a swarm of poisonous snakes, which occupies the same space as the sea fury, acts on its own initiative count, and attacks as directed by the sea fury. The sea fury can control up to three of these swarms at a time.

spells: The sea fury's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Horrific Appearance
traits.desc:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Death Glare
actions.desc: The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

actions.name: Illusory Appearance
actions.desc:
The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like an ugly creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The effect ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.
The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have no claws, but someone touching her hand might feel the claws. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a 16 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.desc: The sea horse can breathe only underwater.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The sea lion can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The sea lion has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The sea lion has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sea lion's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Swimming Leap
traits.desc: With a 10-foot swimming start, the sea lion can long jump out of or across the water up to 25 feet.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sea lion makes three attacks: one bite attack and two claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Seal
monsters.source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The seal can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The seal has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Corrode Metal
traits.desc:
Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage.
The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an oily pool or wet rock.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage, and if the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage.

reactions.name: Split
reactions.desc: When a jelly that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new jellies if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new jelly has hit points equal to half the original jelly's, rounded down. New jellies are one size smaller than the original jelly.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: {@atk mw,rw} +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monsters.name: Shadow
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +6.

traits.name: Sunlight Weakness
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

actions.name: Strength Drain
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.
If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse {@dice 1d4} hours later.

monsters.name: Shadow Assassin
monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The assassin can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the assassin can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

traits.name: Sunlight Weakness
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the assassin has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The assassin makes two Shadow Blade attacks.

actions.name: Shadow Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. Unless the target is immune to necrotic damage, the target's Strength score is reduced by {@dice 1d4} each time it is hit by this attack. The target dies if its Strength is reduced to 0. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a shadow (see the Monster Manual) rises from the corpse {@dice 1d4} hours later.

monsters.name: Shadow Demon
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The demon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in bright light, the demon has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the demon can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 10 (2d6 + 3) psychic damage or, if the demon had advantage on the attack roll, 17 (4d6 + 3) psychic damage.

traits.name: Terror Frenzy (Fury Only)
traits.desc: The spirit has advantage on attack rolls against frightened creatures.

traits.name: Weight of Sorrow (Despair Only)
traits.desc: Any creature, other than you, that starts its turn within 5 feet of the spirit has its speed reduced by 20 feet until the start of that creature's next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Chilling Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1d12 + 3 + summonSpellLevel cold damage.

actions.name: Dreadful Scream (1/Day)
actions.desc: The spirit screams. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be frightened for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Stench
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the shadowghast must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to this Stench for 24 hours.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the shadowghast can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The shadowghast makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 11 (2d8 + 2) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The shambling mound makes two slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled (escape 14), and the shambling mound uses its Engulf on it.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Engulf
actions.desc: The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it. The engulfed target is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the mound's turns or take 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

monsters.name: Shapechanged Roper
monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

traits.name: Grasping Tendrils
traits.desc: The roper can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a 15 Strength check against it.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The roper can use its action to polymorph into a stone object or back to its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The roper makes four attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (4d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tendril
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 50 ft., one creature. The target is grappled (escape 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the roper can't use the same tendril on another target.

actions.name: Reel
actions.desc: The roper pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

monsters.name: Shard Shunner
monsters.damage_immunities: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The Shard Shunner can use their action to polymorph into a rat-humanoid hybrid or into a giant rat, or back into their true form, which is humanoid. Their statistics, other than their size, are the same in each form. Any equipment they are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. They revert to their true form if they die.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The Shard Shunner has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Halfling Nimbleness
traits.desc: The Shard Shunner can move through the space of creatures that is of a size larger than them.

traits.name: Brave
traits.desc: The Shard Shunner has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: The Shard Shunner makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

actions.name: Bite (Rat or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wererat lycanthropy.

actions.name: Shortsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The abomination has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.desc: The abomination can breathe only underwater.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The abomination can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Shield Guardian
monsters.languages: understands commands given in any language but can't speak

traits.name: Bound
traits.desc: The shield guardian is magically bound to an amulet. As long as the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet's wearer can telepathically call the guardian to travel to it, and the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet. If the guardian is within 60 feet of the amulet's wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (rounded up) is transferred to the guardian.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The shield guardian regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

traits.name: Spell Storing
traits.desc: A spellcaster who wears the shield guardian's amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of 4th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the guardian casts the stored spell with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The guardian makes two fist attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Shield
reactions.desc: When a creature makes an attack against the wearer of the guardian's amulet, the guardian grants a +2 bonus to the wearer's AC if the guardian is within 5 feet of the wearer.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the shrieker remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

actions.name: Shriek
actions.desc: When bright light or a creature is within 30 feet of the shrieker, it emits a shriek audible within 300 feet of it. The shrieker continues to shriek until the disturbance moves out of range and for {@dice 1d4} of the shrieker's turns afterward.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
actions.desc:
The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.
[object Object]

monsters.name: Silver Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Metallic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
actions.desc:
The greatwyrm uses one of the following breath weapons:
[object Object]

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

monsters.name: Skeletal Swarm
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Deafening Clatter
traits.desc: Creatures are deafened while in the swarm's space.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Slash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. 11 (2d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monsters.name: Skeleton
monsters.languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Skitterwidget
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, deafened, exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the skitterwidget is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The skitterwidget doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The skitterwidget makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled by the skitterwidget (escape 13).

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) lightning damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

reactions.name: Good Parent
reactions.desc: The skitterwidget imposes disadvantage on one attack roll made against a kiddywidget it can see within 5 feet of it.

actions.name: Sting
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must make a 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Smoke Mephit

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.desc: When the mephit dies, it leaves behind a cloud of smoke that fills a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on its space. The sphere is heavily obscured. Wind disperses the cloud, which otherwise lasts for 1 minute.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Cinder Breath {@recharge}
actions.desc: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of smoldering ash. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 10 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the mephit's next turn.

spells: The mephit can innately cast {@spell dancing lights}, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

monsters.name: Snow Golem
monsters.source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Cold Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the golem is subjected to cold damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the cold damage dealt.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Melt
traits.desc: While in an area of extreme heat, the golem loses {@dice 1d6} hit points at the start of each of its turns.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes three melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Snowball
