actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spores {@recharge}
actions.desc: A 15-foot-radius cloud of toxic spores extends out from the vrock. The spores spread around corners. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, a target takes 5 (1d10) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Emptying a vial of holy water on the target also ends the effect on it.

actions.name: Stunning Screech (1/Day)
actions.desc: The vrock emits a horrific screech. Each creature within 20 feet of it that can hear it and that isn't a demon must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the vrock's next turn.

traits.name: Keen Sight and Smell
traits.desc: The vulture has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The vulture has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the vulture's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

traits.desc: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

If the target is prone, the horse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.desc: The warrior's attack rolls score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.

traits.name: Martial Role
traits.desc:
The warrior has one of the following traits of your choice:
[object Object]

actions.name: Extra Attack
actions.desc: The warrior can attack twice, instead of once, whenever it takes the {@action Attack} action on its turn.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Protection (Defender Only)

monsters.name: Water Elemental
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

traits.name: Water Form
traits.desc: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Freeze
traits.desc: If the elemental takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Whelm {@recharge 4}
actions.desc:
Each creature in the elemental's space must make a 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If it is Large or smaller, it is also grappled (escape 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the elemental's space.
The elemental can grapple one Large creature or up to two Medium or smaller creatures at one time. At the start of each of the elemental's turns, each target grappled by it takes 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. A creature within 5 feet of the elemental can pull a creature or object out of it by taking an action to make a 14 Strength check and succeeding.

monsters.name: Water Weird
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, restrained, prone, unconscious

traits.name: Invisible in Water
traits.desc: The water weird is invisible while fully immersed in water.

traits.name: Water Bound
traits.desc: The water weird dies if it leaves the water to which it is bound or if that water is destroyed.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 13 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape 13) and pulled 5 feet toward the water weird. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the water weird tries to drown it, and the water weird can't constrict another target.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The weasel has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage.

monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_immunities: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The werebat can use its action to polymorph into a Medium bat-humanoid hybrid, or into a Large giant bat, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Echolocation (Bat or Hybrid Form Only)
traits.desc: The werebat has blindsight out to a range of 60 feet as long as it's not deafened.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.desc: The werebat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

traits.name: Nimble Escape (Humanoid Form Only)
traits.desc: The werebat can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the werebat has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: In humanoid form, the werebat makes two scimitar attacks or two shortbow attacks. In hybrid form, it can make one bite attack and one scimitar attack.

actions.name: Bite (Bat or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the werebat gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebat lycanthropy.

actions.name: Scimitar (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.desc: The werebear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

monsters.name: White Dragon Wyrmling
monsters.speed: 30 ft., burrow 15 ft., fly 60 ft., swim 30 ft.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) cold damage.

actions.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The dragon exhales an icy blast of hail in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: White Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Chromatic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled this way at a time.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales a blast of energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 78 (12d12) cold damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary_actions.name: Arcane Spear (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm creates four spears of magical force. Each spear hits a creature of the greatwyrm's choice it can see within 120 feet of it, dealing 12 (1d8 + 8) force damage to its target, then disappears.

monsters.name: Wight
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wight makes two longsword attacks or two longbow attacks. It can use its Life Drain in place of one longsword attack.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a {@creature zombie} under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Flame Seed
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 60 ft., one target you can see. 1d6 + PB fire damage.

actions.name: Fiery Teleportation
actions.desc: The spirit and each willing creature of your choice within 5 feet of it teleport up to 15 feet to unoccupied spaces you can see. Then each creature within 5 feet of the space that the spirit left must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take 1d6 + PB fire damage.

monsters.name: Will-o'-Wisp
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Consume Life
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the will-o'-wisp can target one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, the will-o'-wisp regains 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points.

traits.name: Ephemeral
traits.desc: The will-o'-wisp can't wear or carry anything.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The will-o'-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Variable Illumination
traits.desc: The will-o'-wisp sheds bright light in a 5 to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of ft. equal to the chosen radius. The will-o'-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

actions.name: Shock
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.desc: The will-o'-wisp and its light magically become invisible until it attacks or uses its Consume Life, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Dropped Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, one target directly below the kobold. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Snow Camouflage
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The wolf exhales a blast of freezing wind in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Wood Elf Wizard

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The wood elf has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the wood elf to sleep.

actions.name: Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
actions.desc: The wood elf magically summons a {@creature quasit}, or attempts to summon a {@creature shadow demon} with a {@chance 50|50 percent|50% summoning chance} chance of success. The summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

spells: The wood elf's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Wooden Donkey
monsters.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Beast of Burden
traits.desc: The donkey is considered to be a Large animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.desc: The donkey has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The worg has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity

actions.name: Life Drain

The target must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

actions.name: Create Specter
actions.desc: The wraith targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a {@creature specter} in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The {@creature specter} is under the wraith's control. The wraith can have no more than seven specters under its control at one time.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wyvern makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger. While flying, it can use its claws in place of one other attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Stinger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. The target must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Earth Glide
traits.desc: The xorn can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the xorn doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.desc: The xorn has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

traits.name: Treasure Sense
traits.desc: The xorn can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals and stones, such as coins and gems, within 60 feet of it.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The xorn makes three claw attacks and one bite attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Xvart Speaker
monsters.languages: Abyssal and one additional language (usually Common or Goblin)

traits.name: Low Cunning
traits.desc: The xvart can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

traits.name: Overbearing Pack
traits.desc: The xvart has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to shove a creature if at least one of the xvart's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Raxivort's Tongue
traits.desc: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sling
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Fear of Fire
traits.desc: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Snow Camouflage
traits.desc: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Chilling Gaze
actions.desc: The yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 (3d6) cold damage and then be paralyzed for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yetis) for 1 hour.

traits.name: Fear of Fire

monsters.name: Yochlol

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The yochlol can use its action to polymorph into a form that resembles a female drow or giant spider, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yochlol has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The yochlol can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The yochlol ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The yochlol makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam (Bite in Spider Form)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. (10 feet in demon form), one target. 5 ({@dice 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning (piercing in spider form) damage plus 21 (6d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Mist Form
actions.desc:
The yochlol transforms into toxic mist or reverts to its true form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is also transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
While in mist form, the yochlol is incapacitated and can't speak. It has a flying speed of 30 feet, can hover, and can pass through any space that isn't airtight. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to nonmagical damage.
While in mist form, the yochlol can enter a creature's space and stop there. Each time that creature starts its turn with the yochlol in its space, the creature must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target is incapacitated.

spells: The yochlol's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The yochlol can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Young Amethyst Dragon

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) force damage.

actions.name: Claw

actions.name: Singularity Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc: The dragon creates a shining bead of gravitational force in its mouth, then releases the energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 17 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) force damage, and its speed becomes 0 until the start of the dragon's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

reactions.desc: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the adept deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 3}.
